holidays.title: Maundy Thursday
holidays.description: Maundy refers to the foot-washing Jesus provided the apostles prior to the Last Supper

holidays.title: National Burrito Day
holidays.description: A day to pay homage to the delicious tortillas stuffed with meat, cheese, beans, rice, vegetables, and sauces.

holidays.title: National Siamese Cat Day
holidays.description: Siamese cats, also known as “Meezers," are one of the most popular cat breeds in the world.

holidays.title: National Student-Athlete Day
holidays.description: This day celebrates the student athletes who excel both on the field and in the classroom.

holidays.title: New Beer's Eve
holidays.description: In 1933, the government ended Prohibition. The date was April 7, so grab a beer and toast to your ability to drink it!

holidays.title: Army Day
holidays.description: Let us explore the importance of Army Day and its rich history.

holidays.title: Bohring-Opitz Syndrome Day
holidays.description: Brush up on your knowledge of rare diseases as we observe Bohring-Opitz Syndrome Awareness Day.

holidays.title: California Poppy Day
holidays.description: Let’s get in the spirit of California Poppy Day. Celebrate with us right here, right now!

holidays.title: Chakri Day
holidays.description: Chakri Day celebrates the Chakri royal family, 350 years old, of Thailand.

holidays.title: Drowsy Driver Awareness Day
holidays.description: Shocking statistics show that 62% of Americans attest to driving when feeling drowsy.

holidays.title: Fresh Tomato Day
holidays.description: Work up your appetite, it’s time to celebrate Fresh Tomato Day with us!

holidays.title: Holy Thursday
holidays.description: Holy Thursday is an annual religious event that commemorates the Last Supper of Christ.

holidays.title: Hostess Twinkie Day
holidays.description: Celebrate everyone’s favorite sweet snack on Hostess Twinkie Day right here with us.

holidays.title: International Day of Sport for Development and Peace
holidays.description: This day celebrates how sports have made the world a better place.

holidays.title: Jump Over Things Day
holidays.description: When walking over stuff gets boring, why not spice things up by jumping over them?

holidays.title: Näfelser Fahrt
holidays.description: Let’s observe the day by taking a pilgrimage to the site of the Habsburgs battle.

holidays.title: National Acai Bowl Day
holidays.description: Açaí season is here. Grab a bowl and make it Insta-worthy as we celebrate.

holidays.title: National Alcohol Screening Day
holidays.description: Let’s say no to alcohol, and yes to a healthy body and mind. Let’s take action!

holidays.title: National Caramel Popcorn Day
holidays.description: Let’s all grab a bucket and indulge in this delicious treat today!

holidays.title: National Carbonara Day
holidays.description: Bring out your forks and plates and help yourself to a serving of spaghetti carbonara.

holidays.title: National Employee Benefits Day
holidays.description: Providing employees with benefits that bring a positive change in their life is important.

holidays.title: National Food Faces Day
holidays.description: We love an excuse to play with our food! Thanks, National Food Faces Day.

holidays.title: National Gang Day
holidays.description: On National Gang Day, we honor and appreciate the Gangs in our lives!

holidays.title: National Jay Day
holidays.description: A celebration to let all the Jays in the world know that we appreciate and love them.

holidays.title: National Library Day
holidays.description: Join us as we celebrate libraries and librarians this National Library Day.

holidays.title: National Pajama Day
holidays.description: Have you ever wondered what it would be like to go to work in pajamas?

holidays.title: National Parker Day
holidays.description: We're celebrating everyone named 'Parker,' a solid name that inspires feelings of strength and trust.

holidays.title: National Robert Day
holidays.description: The name Robert is shared by kings, noblemen, celebrities, and international stars.

holidays.title: National Sorry Charlie Day
holidays.description: National Sorry Charlie Day allows us to pause and reflect on the rejections we’ve faced throughout our lives.

holidays.title: National Student Athlete Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the exceptional student athletes around you on National Student-Athlete Day.

holidays.title: National Tartan Day
holidays.description: National Tartan Day commemorates the day that the Scottish Declaration of Independence was signed in 1320.

holidays.title: National Taylor Day
holidays.description: Today is a day to celebrate and honor all the Taylors worldwide.

holidays.title: National Teflon Day
holidays.description: Get your Teflon pans and pots out as we celebrate this wonderful discovery.

holidays.title: New Beer's Eve
holidays.description: Enjoy a sip of your favorite drink on New Beer’s Eve and rejoice that you may.

holidays.title: President Ntaryamira Day
holidays.description: Remembering a beloved national leader, his tragic death, and the resolve to become a better nation.

holidays.title: Theravada New Year
holidays.description: Theravada New Year unites Buddhists in self-reflection and meditation wherever it is celebrated.

holidays.title: World Table Tennis Day
holidays.description: It's raining celluloid balls on World Table Tennis Day, so get those rackets and play.

holidays.title: Mingyu’s Birthday
holidays.description: By eighth grade, Mingyu knew how to play most musical instruments — talk about a young prodigy!

holidays.title: Peyton List’s Birthday
holidays.description: We celebrate this former child star who has now become an established model and actress.
